english.subject: eng
english.paragraph: Life at sea demands mental resilience and disciplined conduct. Crew members must remain vigilant during long voyages, especially when navigating through unpredictable weather systems. Although advanced radar systems assist navigation, human judgment remains indispensable.
english.question: What is the tone of the paragraph?

english.paragraph: Modern maritime operations rely heavily on automation. However, automation does not eliminate responsibility. Officers must interpret data accurately and make decisive judgments during emergencies.
english.question: Which statement best summarizes the paragraph?
options: Automation assists but does not replace human judgment.

The vessel resumed its journey before the storm subsided.
The storm had subsided after the vessel resumed its journey.

She says she had been monitoring the radar since dawn.
She said that she monitored the radar since dawn.

english.subject: eng
english.paragraph: Maritime logistics has evolved dramatically in the past decade. Digital tracking systems now allow shipping companies to monitor cargo in real time. Yet, technology alone cannot eliminate risks. Strategic planning and experienced leadership remain fundamental to successful navigation and trade.
english.question: Which of the following is implied in the passage?
options: Human expertise is still essential despite technological progress.

english.subject: eng
english.paragraph: Training aboard a vessel instills discipline and accountability. Cadets quickly learn that negligence can have far-reaching consequences, affecting not only the crew but also international trade operations. Responsibility at sea is not optional; it is mandatory.
english.question: What central idea does the paragraph emphasize?
options: Discipline and responsibility are essential at sea.
